Registration and full payment preferred, however we do accept drop-ins on a space available basis – drop in fee is $10/pp/time. Adult Coed Volleyball • Register • View Cart • Location:  LMS Gym, Littleton, MA This upbeat co-ed volleyball program offers adults the opportunity to enjoy all the excitement of competitive volleyball in a friendly and supportive environment.  Previous playing experience (ability to bump, set and hit) required for joining either night.  Each evening, participants will initially be divided into 2 teams, which are then shuffled half way through to re-balance play.  Come join the fun, meet people, and benefit from the exercise! Registration and full payment preferred, however we do accept drop-ins on a space available basis – drop in fee is $10/pp/time. Sessions that do not reach minimums may be canceled. Day-of registration is $10 per visit . Each class emphasizes safe range conduct, proper form, and steady skill progression—great for brand-new archers and returners. Program Snapshot Who: Ages 9–Adult (no prior experience required) Schedule: Fridays, 6:15–7:15 PM (various date ranges shown below) Coaches: USA Archery–certified instructors Equipment: All gear provided (recurve bows, arrows, arm guards) Format: Progressive lessons, safety briefings, guided target practice, and weekly challenges Session Length: Typically 5 weeks (see dates below) Skills & Benefits Fundamentals: stance, grip, anchor, aim, release, follow-through Consistent form and shot grouping to build accuracy and confidence Focus, patience, and body control in a supportive Program Snapshot Where: Fairbank Community Center – Community Center Gym (40 Fairbank Rd, Sudbury, MA) Format: Round-robin rotation (self-managed with on-site guidance) Session Length: 6 weeks (fall blocks typically run 5–6 weeks) Capacity: Max 21 players per time slot Thursday Night Pickleball Day/Time: Thursdays, 6:00 PM – 8:00 PM Skill Level: Intermediate+ (you know the rules, have some experience, and play occasionally) Max Participants: 21 Format: Round-robin rotation; keep matches moving and rotate promptly Saturday Morning Pickleball Session 1: 9:00 AM – 11:00 AM — Intermediate+ Session 2: 11:15 AM – 1:15 PM — Open Level Max Participants (each session): 21 Format: Round-robin rotation; fair, quick court changes How Rotations Work Check in at the front desk on the digital pad before stepping on court. Note: Scanning is not available. Place your paddle in the queue and join the next available court. Play to a standard game (or timed games if crowded), then rotate per the posted instructions. Winners split; new partners each round to keep play balanced and social. Sudbury Park and Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Pickleball Clinics w/Coach Jim Acton • Register • View Cart • Pickleball Clinics with Coach Jim Acton Fairbank Community Center • 40 Fairbank Road, Sudbury, MA Who Ages 15+ • Co-ed Instructor Coach Jim Acton Locations Fairbank Community Center Gym 40 Fairbank Rd. Sudbury, MA What to Bring Indoor non-marking shoes, paddle (loaners limited), water About Pickleball Pickleball combines elements of tennis, badminton, and ping-pong on a 44' × 20' court. It’s accessible for beginners and scales to fast, competitive play for experienced athletes. Sudbury Parks & Recreation offers instructional clinics that blend technique, strategy, and guided play. Clinic Descriptions Beginner Clinic Learn the fundamentals: court setup, grip, ground strokes, serve/return, dinks, scoring, and basic strategy. Etiquette and safety included. Loaner paddles available. Advanced Beginner Clinic For players who’ve taken a clinic or have been playing and understand basic rules and skills. Emphasis on continued skill development, footwork, positioning, and winning strategies through drills and game play. Up the River / Down the River Playing Clinic Competitive game format with on-court coaching. After each 12-minute game, winners move up a court and others move down. For players who know the rules/scoring or have prior clinic experience. Specialty Clinic: Dinks Focus on non-volley zone play (the kitchen): dinking mechanics, control, patterns, and setups—then apply concepts in full games. Specialty Clinic: Third Shots — Drops & Drives Build reliable third-shot drops and purposeful drives. Technique progressions move into situational drills and coached points. Early registration helps ensure clinics meet minimums and run as scheduled. Sudbury Park and Recreation Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Account Login Create Account Account Login Create Account Register Programs Search Activities Memberships Facilities Facility List Calendar General Info News Dept Info Meetings Gallery Team Info Contact Contact Us Help How to Register Affiliates Municipal Site Register Now Skip to nav Pickleball Private Court Reservations - 1.5's • Register • View Cart • Pickleball Private Court Rentals Fairbank Community Center • Community Center Gym (Indoor Courts) Enjoy your own private pickleball court with family or friends. One person registers for the whole group (up to 6 players ), and you’ll have a dedicated court for your entire reservation — an easy way to play with your own group without open-play rotations. Quick Facts Fees $25 Resident • $35 Non-Resident Pickleball Program Members: 25% off Group Size Up to 6 players per court One registrant reserves on behalf of the entire group. What’s Included One (1) court + one (1) net Bring your own paddles and balls. Location & Check-In Fairbank Community Center — Community Center Gym Please check in at the front desk before entering the gym. Available Time Blocks 6:00–7:30 AM 7:30–9:00 AM small gap for pre-k soccer 9:30–11:00 AM If a time shows Full , it isn’t available. You can select as many future dates as you’d like — please double-check the exact date(s) before completing checkout. How It Works 1) One Person Registers Reserve a single court for your group (max 6 players). The registrant pays the full session fee; no additional checkouts needed for guests. 2) Arrive & Check In Head to the Parks & Rec desk to check in. Staff will confirm your reservation and court assignment. 3) Play Your Session Enjoy your private court for the full reserved time with no rotations . Play only with your group, and please finish on time so the next group can begin promptly. Notes & Policies Member Discount 25% off for current Sudbury Rec Pickleball Program members. Log into your MyRec account; eligible discounts apply at checkout. You won’t see the discount until checkout. Footwear & Equipment Clean, non-marking indoor shoes required. Bring your own paddles and balls (net provided). Water only in the gym; no food permitted. Use Guidelines Private recreational use only; no paid instruction or subletting. Max 6 players per court. Please respect staff directions and posted gym rules. Scheduling Available dates/times are posted online. If a slot shows Full , it’s not available. You may select multiple future dates in one checkout — please double-check the date(s) you’ve selected before paying. Cancellations: account credit may be issued; cancellations made at least 7 business days in advance are eligible per policy. Questions? Contact Sudbury Parks & Recreation at recreation@sudbury.ma.us or 978-443-1092. Links: cancelations and refund policy How to register for programs, click here to review the video. Sessions are grouped by ability, so everyone learns at the right pace in a supportive environment. Use the level guide below to choose your best fit, then select a registration option at the bottom (dates/times/fees are listed in the registration lines). Note: Schedule may adjust due to weather, elections, or building maintenance. Loaner paddles and balls are available. Introductory Pickleball Coaching (Beginner) Brand-new players or those returning after a long break. Learn rules, court layout, scoring, safe movement, grip/stance, and core strokes (serve, return, forehand, backhand). Simple progressions with lots of guided reps in a welcoming setting. Outcome: Comfort with basics and readiness for friendly open play. 2.5 Advanced-Beginner Pickleball Coaching You know the fundamentals and want consistency. Build reliable serve/return, cleaner contact, footwork and positioning, and controlled dinks. Intro to third-shot options and simple doubles communication and rotation. Outcome: Longer rallies and confident participation in social doubles. 3.0 Low-Intermediate Pickleball Coaching Solidify patterns and shot selection. Emphasis on third-shot drop vs. drive, transition footwork to the kitchen, sustained dinking, soft resets, and opportunistic attacking. Scenario-based points with feedback on court coverage and teamwork. Outcome: Execute core patterns reliably and convert more points at the kitchen. 3.5 Intermediate Pickleball Coaching For experienced players aiming to sharpen tactics. Pace control, resets from the mid-court, targeted third shots, reading and countering speed-ups, baiting, stacking/switching, and smarter positioning. High-rep drill blocks plus coached, situational play. Outcome: Higher conversion in fast exchanges and league/tournament play. Drills Pickleball Coaching (All Level) Fast-paced stations to maximize touches: ball-fed sequences, serve/return ladders, third-shot repetitions, transition volleys, hand-speed games, and short coached play. Great add-on for any level to build mechanics and conditioning. Outcome: Sharper mechanics, better stamina, and skills that carry into match play. Coached Round Robin Play (3-Week Session) A fun hybrid of play and instruction! Players rotate through matches while receiving live, on-court coaching. Coaches offer in-game feedback on positioning, shot selection, and tactics during real-time play. Perfect for those ready to test their skills under expert guidance. Outcome: Improved court awareness, smarter decision-making, and confidence in match situations. Who: Adults 17+  • Where: Fairbank Community Center Gym (Side B / Court #3)  • How to Register: Choose your level above, then select your preferred session from the registration options below (dates/times/fees are shown in the registration lines).
